text:
Hey folks, is there a way, using drag & drop template that only contains modules to add my own `<style></style>` tags in between the `<head></head>`  that HubSpot automatically adds..
I tried to create a module that only contains style tag and calling it as the first section of my drag & drop template but this does not work...
Issue is, style tags are not between head tags, then gmail responsive does not works because my style tags are ignored.. Any of you faced this before ?

That seems like a route we can explore. Indeed we do not need auto emails as we are using our own stack and custom workflows(on our own servers) to trigger the emails as needed. As such we don’t necessarily require any properties at all. It was a “nice to have” feature that the single send API would create/update a user if they didn’t exist but doesn’t matter. I’ll reach out to our account rep to get access to programmable emails.
Has anyone been able to resubscribe a bunch of contacts after an full opt-out? I know this is not possible through the API, but I was thinking to use the form submission API.
